title: <xsl:for-each>
summary: The <xsl:for-each> element selects a set of nodes and processes each of them in the same way. It is often used to iterate through a set of nodes or to change the current node. If one or more <xsl:sort> elements appear as the children of this element, sorting occurs before processing. Otherwise, nodes are processed in document order.
pageTitle: <xsl:for-each> - XSLT: Extensible Stylesheet Language Transformations | MDN
